newsitem.title: VATICAN: Pope calls for peace in eastern Zaire.
newsitem.headline: Pope calls for peace in eastern Zaire.

text.p: Pope John Paul on Sunday called on warring sides in eastern Zaire to lay down their arms and seek a peaceful solution to their conflict.
"I ask you again not to forget the ordeal that is raging in Africa, in the Great Lakes region," the Pope told pilgrims in St Peter's Square in his weekly Angelus message.
He said refugees from Rwanda and Burundi and the people of eastern Zaire were victims of "fratricidal fighting...hunger, insecurity...mass exoduses from cities and villages, atrocities and horrors".
"I renew my invitation to those who are involved in this conflict to cease their violence immediately and seek a peaceful solution through dialogue and negotiations," he said.
It was not the first time the Pope had spoken out on the situation in eastern Zaire.
Last month, he said a multinational force for eastern Zaire should be deployed to find and help the refugees, estimated at up to 500,000.
Zairean rebel forces in the area oppose the deployment of a multinational force, apparently for fear that the force might try to restore the authority of the Kinshasa government.
A small Canadian-led force has already set up headquarters at Kampala in neighbouring Uganda but political problems have prevented it starting its mission.
